* Autofumen
Off the coattails of [[https://github.com/steadshot/fumenizer][fumenizer]], a python script which aims to create a [[http://fumen.zui.jp/][Fumen Tetris Diagram]] from playfield images, Autofumen is a proof-of-concept script that aims to read memory from MAME to build Tetris diagrams. This requires MAME with the TapTracker patches to function and only works with TGM2+ for now.

* Usage
Python module dependencies: pyperclip

After running the modified version of MAME (with TapTracker patches), simply run autofumen.py. It should be compatible with both python2 and python3:

#+BEGIN_SRC sh
  python ./autofumen.py
#+END_SRC

Once a game is finished ("Game Over" is shown), a fumen link is both output to the console and copied to your clipboard. Paste that link into your favorite browser and voila!

* Credits
The original fumen.py (as seen in [[https://github.com/steadshot/fumenizer][fumenizer]]) was written by raincomplex. Thanks to that module, this prototype was able to be made quickly and without much headache. Fumen's javascript is pretty difficult to digest (most of the comments are in Japanese and the variables have obscure names) and this user took the time to translate its encode function to python.

* Sample
- [[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8mD7VRXorEI][Video of TGM2+'s "TA Death" mode]] + [[http://fumen.zui.jp/?v110@#english.js][Generated Diagram]]
